question: What happens if I fail a subject?
answer: If you fail a subject, you can re-enrol in it once (total of two attempts). If you fail the second enrolment in an obligatory or elective subject, your studies will be terminated. Termination occurs under Section 56, Para 1 (b) of the Higher Education Act.
answer_generated: If you fail a subject, you can retake the exam once. If you fail the subject again, your studies will be terminated. The supervisor will be present at the retake of the examination.
context:
Document 1: The list of subjects  is entered  into the CTU electronic  
information  system  after  the approval  of ISP. 
 (7) The assessment  of specializ ation  examinations  and language  examinations  is carried  out on the 
scale  “excellent”,  “pass”,  “fail”.   These  are entered  into the CTU electronic  information  system  as 
“1”, “2”, “3”. 
 (8) If the result  of a specialization  examination  is “fail”,  the doctoral  stude nt can retake  the exam  
once.   The supervisor  is present  at the retake  of the examination.   In case  the same  subject  is 
evaluated  again  with  a “fail”,  the studies  will be terminated  pursuant  to Section  56, Para  1 (b) of 
the Act and Article  34, Para  7 (b) here of.  The decision -making  in this matter  is governed  by 
Section  68 of the Act.
